bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Dorma V. Schnurr to Philip Showalter Hench, June 6, 1941

div1.p: Schnurr relays to Hench that Kissinger suffered a stroke and is unconscious.

div1.head: Telegram from Dorma V. Schnurr to Philip Showalter Hench, June 6, 1941
div1.p:
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.

SYMBOLS
DL = Day Letter
NT = Overnight Telegram
LC = Deferred Cable
NLT = Cable Night Letter
Ship Radiogram

NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination

NH330 10 = ROCHESTER MINN 6 22 3P
DR P S HENCH = HOTEL EASTON

KISSINGER UNCONSCIOUS SINCE STROKE WEDNESDAY. PHYSICIANS
GIVE WIFE LITTLE ENCOURAGEMENTS=
D SCHNURR.
THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
